title: Indirect Material Group Leader (Level 6)
description:
Job Description

What you will do?

 As a Production Group Leader, you are responsible for the effective use of personnel, material, and equipment. Participates in the training, developing and evaluating of hourly team members. Participates in the development of highly effective teams. Leads Global Manufacturing Systems(GMS) processes and serves as resource supporting launch and pilot activities in assigned areas. Meets or exceeds production cost schedule and maintains quality requirements. Maintains awareness of quality standards, and communicates department quality goals, and leverages resources to solve quality issues. Builds and maintains good working relationships with employees, union and management. Understands and consistently administer the National and Local Agreements between General Motors and the United Auto Workers Union. Implements and follows systems that prevent reoccurrence of known issues. Promote safe work practices and achieve objectives for ergonomics, health and


safety and housekeeping.

 Motivates, trains and develops employees to effectively perform their jobs utilizing standardized methods. Ensure team members receive adequate JIT (job instruction training). Achieve production schedules and product requirements by applying lean manufacturing/synchronous principles with emphasis on variation reduction, control costs, and achieve productivity improvements. Coach, teach, counsel and mentor Group Leaders in these responsibilities.


Additional Job Description

Habilidades Requeridas:

Carreras afines: Ingeniería Industrial o experiencia afín.Experiencia requerida en posiciones similares: de 1 a 3 años.Esquema laboral: 5x2 (de lunes a viernes)Nivel de Inglés: intermedio-avanzadoConocimientos: Administración de almacenes, manejos de equipo de trabajo, sistemas de producción, conocimientos logísticos y sistemas de manufactura.


Competencias Deseadas:

Manejo de personas, solución de problemas, trabajo en equipo, creatividad, motivación a pares y otros, negociación, planeación, enfoque en resultados, generación estratégica, comunicación. 


En Sitio: Esta posición requiere trabajo presencial en sitio a tiempo completo.

Si requieres algún ajuste razonable para continuar con tu proceso de selección, informa tu reclutador.

Recuerda adjuntar tu CV al momento de postularte.

La diversidad y la inclusión son nuestras fortalezas. Respetamos y valoramos lo que cada individuo ofrece a nuestro equipo, incluyendo su procedencia, educación, sexo, raza, grupo étnico, orientación sexual, expresión y/o identidad de género, contexto religioso, edad, generación, y discapacidad. Creemos que nuestra habilidad para satisfacer las necesidades y expectativas de una base de clientes cada vez más diversa y global se vincula de cerca a la diversidad e inclusión que vivimos dentro General Motors.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

title: Becario de Ingeniería en Diseño
description:
Job Description

Collaborating on innovation challenges, interacting with Industry leaders, attending cross-functional networking events and volunteering for community service activities.

Additional Job Description

Responsable de:

Desarrollar un proyecto en la organización relacionado a ingeniería en diseñoRecibir y aprobar el entrenamiento CAD y NXDar soporte a ingenieros sr en actividades diariasDesarrollo de presentacionesBases de datos y análisis de informaciónEntregables en modelos matemáticos de CAD


Requisitos:

 Estar cursando los últimos periodos de formación académica superior (semestre o cuatrimestre) Graduación Diciembre 2024 o posterior Contar con un nivel intermedio conversacional de inglés Seguro facultativo vigente Office


Carreras: 

Mecánica / Electromecánica / Industrial / Electrónica/ Mecatrónica / Sistemas / Aeronáutica / Diseño Industrial / Química / Sistemas Energéticos Sustentables / o a fín

title: Becario de Operaciones de Vehículos Corporativos
description:
Job Description

Supports to administrate all the TREC assigned, unassigned and supplementary vehiclesSupports to perform the E2E process for internal sales to employees and dealer auctionsSupports to administrate process for platingProvide customer support for employeesSupports to administrate antilaundering and REPUVE reports for Central Office salesSupports to administrate invoices for PDI and Maintenance and manage dealer relationshipsMonitor and maintain vehicle inventory levelsEnsure adherence to all CVO policies and programs


Additional Job Description

Responsable de:

Administrar la flota vehicular del centro de trabajoAdministración de todos los vehículos asignados, no asignados y complementarios del centro de trabajoRealizar el proceso E2E para ventas internas a empleados y subastas de distribuidoresSoporte para administrar el proceso de blindajeProporcionar atención al cliente para los empleados.Soporte para entregar tarjetas corporativas a empleados y a las demás sedes de GMMSoporte para administrar reportes antilavado y REPUVE para ventaAdmite la administración de facturas de PDI y mantenimiento y la gestión de las relaciones con los distribuidoresSupervisar y mantener los niveles de inventario de vehículosGarantizar el cumplimiento de todas las políticas y programas de CVO


Requisitos:

 Estar cursando los últimos periodos de formación académica superior (semestre o cuatrimestre) Graduación Verano 2025 o posterior Contar con un nivel intermedio conversacional de inglés Seguro facultativo vigente Office


Carreras: Administrativas / Ingenierías O afín

title: TECNICO DE MANTENIMIENTO COMPLEJO TOLUCA
description:
Job Description

Responsable de :

Ejecutar actividades de arranque de turno Revisar estatus de línea con LETAtención a llamados de Andon/Ayuda Brindar apoyo para la ejecución de la Auditoria Escalonada Dar soporte para la elaboración MST o PRETASK Participar en actividades de mejora continua Reportar condiciones de seguridad Ejecutar ordenes de trabajo de Mantenimiento Ejecución y registro de mantenimiento no programado Llevar e identificar refaccionesEjecutar actividades de WPO Identificación de material Actividades proactivas de mantenimiento Soportar actividades de RCM Revisión Espejo 


Additional Job Description

Escolaridad mínima: Carrera técnica en: Mecatrónica, Mecánica, Eléctrica, Electrónica, Mecánica Industrial o afín a mantenimiento de procesos industriales.Amplio conocimiento en sistemas eléctricos y mecánicos incluyendo: electricidad y electrónica (PLC/CNC), controles e instrumentación, conductores mecánicos, neumáticos, hidráulicos. Conocimiento de robots SIEMENS/ FANUCConocimiento de procesos secuenciados y capacidad de diagnóstico a través de la observación y el análisis.Conocimiento general del mantenimiento preventivo, predictivo y correctivoExperiencia: DeseableDisponible para rolar turnosEnfoque al trabajo no cíclicoEnfoque a la Calidad y seguridad

title: Becario de Compras
description:
Job Description

Creación y mantenimiento de bases de datos (Excel Avanzado, Macros y PowerBI) para medir el desempeño de todos los KPI (Key Performance Indicators) del equipo de Compras de Hoses and Lines. Soporte directo al CTL (Creativity Team Leader) en el mantenimiento y optimizacion de los reportes mensuales/Semanales requeridos para la administracion del presupuesto (Varianza, Threats and Ops, Budget, Top Priorities, etc) y los diversos proyectos del equipo (Cambios de direccion de programas que requieren accion coordinada del equipo), asi como en la organizacion y seguimiento de las juntas semanales de "Office Hours" con los compradores, CTL, Supervisor y Gerente, la junta de estrategia con Ingenieria y la de Creativity Team con el equipo Global.

Desarrollo de base de datos en Power BI y Excel avanzado. Desarrollo de un proceso documentado y diagrama de flujo que describa los pasos y las fuentes necesarias para actualizar de manera periodica dichas bases de datos. Desarrollo y presentacion de actualizaciones en formatos de reporteo estandarizados del desempeño y tendencia de los indicadores antes mencionados. Asistir con actividades diversas de caracter administrativo al CTL (Creativity Team Leader). Reporte directo con CTL (Creativity Team Leader) e indirecto con Gerente del equipo

Additional Job Description

Responsable de:

 Desarrollo de dashboardsSoporte a compradores en cambios de ingenieríaDesarrollo de base de datos en Power BI y Excel avanzado.Desarrollo de un proceso documentado y diagrama de flujo que describa los pasos y las fuentes necesarias para actualizar de manera periódica dichas bases de datos.Desarrollo y presentación de actualizaciones en formatos de reporteo estandarizados del desempeño y tendencia de los indicadores antes mencionados.


Requisitos:

 Estar cursando los últimos periodos de formación académica superior (semestre o cuatrimestre) Graduación Verano 2025 o posterior Contar con un nivel intermedio conversacional de inglés Seguro facultativo vigente Office


Carreras: Ingeniería Mecatronica / Ingeniería Mecánica / Ingeniería Industrial / Ingeniería Sistemas O afín

Diversity and inclusion are our strengths. We respect and value what each individual contribution to our team, including their origin, education, sex, race, ethnic group, sexual orientation, gender expression and / or identity, religious context, age, generation, and disability. We believe that our ability to meet the needs and expectations of an increasingly diverse and global customer base is closely linked to the diversity and inclusion that we experience within General Motors.

La diversidad y la inclusión son nuestras fortalezas. Respetamos y valoramos lo que cada individuo ofrece a nuestro equipo, incluyendo su procedencia, educación, sexo, raza, grupo étnico, orientación sexual, expresión y/o identidad de género, contexto religioso, edad, generación, y discapacidad. Creemos que nuestra habilidad para satisfacer las necesidades y expectativas de una base de clientes cada vez más diversa y global se vincula de cerca a la diversidad e inclusión que vivimos dentro General Motors.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

title: GBS Accounting Analyst (Level 6)
description:
Job Description

 Perform General Ledger functions; assure accuracy, timeliness, and conformity with professional accounting standards and best practices in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) Identify, interpret and analyze potential accounting risks and issues Research and analyze accounting transactions and contracts Identify and execute internal controls, SOX compliance and financial procedures Partner with Finance to determine accounting implications of transactions and perform analytical analyses to utilize when making all material business decisions Assist with internal and external financial reporting - including analyzing consolidated results, drafting SEC documents and management review reports, ensuring quality, and administering strict timeline Evaluate current accounting practices and policies and drive continuous improvement Research and interpret new accounting standards and brainstorm how each applies to GM as well as comply with external 10-Q/10-K reporting requirements Provides direction to a team of individuals with similar functional responsibility


Additional Job Description

Required Qualifications

Accounting or Finance Bachelor DegreeAccounting Experience (1-3 years)Intermediate / Advance English


Preferred Qualifications

Desirable SAP KnowledgeDesirable Power Bi, Knime and Python Knowledge


Hybrid: This position requires to work 3 days on site 2 days at home remote on a full-time basis

Remember to attach your CV when applying to this vacancy.

title: Finance Analyst - Track Program (Level 6)
description:
Job Description

Hybrid role: This position requires to work 3 days on site and 2 days at home remote, on a full-time basis

What you will do:

 Demonstrate deep functional knowledge, had breadth of experiences to work autonomously on the most complex business issues, may assist Leadership with strategy development Proactively analyze business results (vs. forecast, budget and prior year) to identify trends, risks and optimize business results Apply financial analysis tools and work experiences to influence current and future profitability (e.g. financial models, business cases, run rate, advanced data analytics) Prepare reports with insights for monthly operating review and /or Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s), anticipating business questions based on content Operate autonomously, where ambiguity and time constraints exist Analyze trends to establish bold yet achievable targets, forecasts and variance explanations Lead financial analysis as a member of cross functional teams (e.g. OpEx, new business opportunity) Effectively communicate financial performance and results of analysis performed to Senior Finance Leadership and key business partners anticipating questions Proactively seeks opportunities to grow (e.g. develops new skills, attend training opportunities, network, feedback)


Additional Job Description

Skills:

Analytical Thinking - Proficient

Autonomy - Proficient

Leading with Influence - Demonstrates

Professional Courage - Demonstrates

Project Management - Proficient

Public Presentation - Proficient

Relationship Management - Proficient

Knowledge:

Excel Advanced (Required)

Power BI, Knime And/or Other Data Analytics Tools (Preferred)

English (Written & Oral) Advanced (Required)

Experience/Education:

>2 years of work experience in Finance

Desired Studying or a plan to start Master Degree (MBA, Finance, International Business, Administration, Economy) or Graduates in Bachelor Degree in Administrative Fields ( Accounting, Finance, Economy), or Engineering with Finance Skills

Remember to attach your CV when applying to this vacancy.

title: Launch Controls Engineering (Level 7)
description:
Job Description

Other responsibilities will include:

 You will analyze and implement product or machinery designs for the best method for manufacturing processes You will propose and evaluate the processes for equipment in assigned area Direct the design, development, and/or improvement of manufacturing processes for assigned area You will keep regular contact with partners outside the work group You will provide direction to small group of technical employees You may evaluate or monitor expenditures for processes and/or equipment


Additional Job Description

Work Apropertly

On Site: This position requires to work on site on a full-time basis

Required Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s Degree: Electrical Engineer, Mechatronic Engineer, Electronic systems Engineer, Electronics and communications Engineer, Robotics Engineer and all Engineering related.Required experience in similar position: from 3 to 5 years.Available to change shifts (4x3, 5x2, 6x1).English Level: Intermediate- Intermediate


Key Skills: Experience working with PLCs from Rockwell brands (Programming and troubleshooting skills)

Knowledge in, Fanuc Robots, HMI programing & Related control system, Industrial Networks


Preferred Qualifications:

Microsoft Office.


Remember to attach your CV when applying to this vacancy.

Diversity and inclusion are our strengths. We respect and value what each individual contribution to our team, including their origin, education, sex, race, ethnic group, sexual orientation, gender expression and / or identity, religious context, age, generation, and disability. We believe that our ability to meet the needs and expectations of an increasingly diverse and global customer base is closely linked to the diversity and inclusion that we experience within General Motors.

La diversidad y la inclusión son nuestras fortalezas. Respetamos y valoramos lo que cada individuo ofrece a nuestro equipo, incluyendo su procedencia, educación, sexo, raza, grupo étnico, orientación sexual, expresión y/o identidad de género, contexto religioso, edad, generación, y discapacidad. Creemos que nuestra habilidad para satisfacer las necesidades y expectativas de una base de clientes cada vez más diversa y global se vincula de cerca a la diversidad e inclusión que vivimos dentro General Motors.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

title: Controls Engineer (Level 7)
description:
Job Description

What you will do?

In this role, you will manage the maintenance and repair of plant equipment and facilities aligned with standard GM maintenance systems in addition to the following responsibilities:

 You will conduct appropriate checks and tests, and communicate evaluation of results Recommends solutions to problems Responsible for preventative maintenance and diagnosis of equipment malfunctions Meets schedule and quality requirements Complies with the terms of local and national labor agreements Implements divisional and corporate policies and safety and good housekeeping practices Maintain frequent contact and collaboration in other areas outside of working group Responsible for the effective use of personnel, material and equipment Establishes a course of action to accomplish completion of the job and/or project. Has knowledge and ability to implement GMS principles


Maintain the backups updated of the electronic equipment using UDC system.

Inventory of the controls diagnostic equipment, tools and software.Continuous development of technical skill according to the versatility chart , technical training.Maintain and trouble shooting of the manufacturing system functionality ( PMC , ANDON , FLEXNET ).Generate technical reports of trouble shooting process and improvements implemented.Attend meetings and follow up: TIP continuous improvement, teamwork, manufacturing systems, safety.


Work Appropriately

On Site: This position requires to work on site on a full-time basis

Additional Job Description

Required Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s Degree: Mechatronic, Mechanical, Electrical Engineer and all Engineering related.Required experience in similar position: from 3 to 5 years.Available to change shifts (4x3, 5x2, 6x1).English Level: Advanced.


Key Skills: 

Preferred Qualifications:

Interpretation of Electrical drawings.

Electrical specifications and standards.

Siemens S7 PLC Programming, trouble shooting.

Siemens 840D Solution Line Programming, trouble shooting.

Siemens HMI configuration.

Networks Profibus, Profinet , Ethernet communication and configuration.

Fanuc Robot Programming, trouble shooting.

Vision systems: Cameras, Scanners.

Remember to attach your CV when applying to this vacancy.
